fifa_rules.title: Offside Rule
fifa_rules.description: A player is in an offside position if they are closer to the opponent's goal line than both the ball and the second-last opponent when the ball is played to them by a teammate. This rule helps prevent players from gaining an unfair advantage by staying near the opponent's goal.

fifa_rules.title: Handball
fifa_rules.description: Not every touch of a player's hand/arm with the ball is an offence. A handball is only a foul if the hand/arm is deliberately used to make contact with the ball. The referee will consider the movement of the hand/arm in relation to the body's overall movement.

fifa_rules.title: Yellow and Red Cards
fifa_rules.description: A yellow card is a caution for unsporting behavior. A red card means the player is sent off. Two yellow cards in the same match result in a red card and ejection from the game. Red cards can be issued for serious foul play, violent conduct, or other severe infractions.
